{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Braya linearis |accepted_authority=Rouy |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Ill. Pl. Eur. |place=11: 84. 1899 |year=1899 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Brassicaceae;Brassicaceae tribe Euclidieae;Braya;Braya linearis |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Brassicaceae]]
tribe[[Brassicaceae tribe Euclidieae]]
genus[[Braya]]
species[[Braya linearis]]
|volume=Volume 7 |mention_page=page 546, 551 |treatment_page=page 550 }}Plants not scapose; sparsely to moderately pubescent throughout, trichomes subsessile or sessile, submalpighiaceous, 2-forked, and simple. Stems simple or few to several from base, erect, (usually unbranched), (0.4–)0.7–1.4(–1.8) dm. Basal leaves (without distinct petiole); blade linear to narrowly spatulate, 0.5–3 cm × 0.5–2(–3) mm, base attenuate or cuneate, margins dentate (with 1 or 2 teeth per side) or entire, apex obtuse, (surfaces glabrous or sparsely pubescent). Cauline leaves: 1–4 (each stem); (subsessile); blade similar to basal, smaller distally. (Racemes not elongated in fruit.) Fruiting pedicels erect to divaricate, 1–4.5 mm. Flowers: sepals 1.8–2.8 × 1–1.4 mm (sometimes slightly saccate basally); petals white or purplish (especially claw), (broadly obovate or spatulate), 2.5–3.5(–4) × 1.3–2 mm; filaments 1.5–2 mm; anthers oblong, 0.4–0.6 mm. Fruits linear, more or less torulose, (straight or somewhat curved), (0.5–)0.9–1.2(–1.4) cm × 0.9–1.3 mm (uniform in width); valves glabrous or sparsely pubescent, trichomes simple and submalpighiaceous; septum margin not expanded, or not basally; ovules 20–28 per ovary; style 0.3–0.5 mm; stigma weakly 2-lobed to entire. Seeds uniseriate to weakly biseriate, oblong, 0.8–1 × 0.3–0.6 mm. 2n = 42.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Jul. |habitat=Dry or moist calcareous soils and alkaline clays and sands at the margins of evaporation pools on stream bank terraces and moraines |elevation=0-200 m |distribution=Greenland;Europe (Scandinavia). |discussion=

Braya linearis appears to be related to the European and Asian species of the genus. Hybridization studies with B. alpina from the European Alps (T. W. Böcher 1973) produced fertile F1 hybrids. DNA sequence evidence (S. I. Warwick et al. 2004) confirmed the close relationship between B. linearis and B. alpina, but suggested that B. linearis is even more closely related to B. humilis and the Asian B. siliquosa Bunge.

tribe[[Brassicaceae tribe Euclidieae]]
genus[[Braya]]
species[[Braya longii]]
|volume=Volume 7 |mention_page=page 546, 547 |treatment_page=page 551 }}Plants scapose; sparsely pubescent, trichomes simple and 2-forked. Stems simple or few to several from base, erect, (unbranched), 0.3–1.1(–1.5) dm. Basal leaves: blade narrowly spatulate to oblanceolate, (0.5–)1–3(–5) cm × 1–3.5 mm, base (membranous), broadly expanded near point of attachment, margins entire, (sparsely ciliate proximally), apex obtuse. Cauline leaves: 0 or 1 (or a leaflike bract subtending proximalmost pedicel). Fruiting pedicels erect or ascending, (1.2–)1.5–4.5(–4.9) mm. Flowers: sepals 2–3(–3.5) × (1.1–)1.2–1.7 mm; petals white (or claw purplish), (3–)3.3–4.8(–5) × (1.2–)1.4–2.5(–3) mm, (claw and blade usually well-differentiated, apex rounded); filaments 1.7–2 mm; anthers oblong, 0.3–0.4 mm. Fruits lanceoloid-subulate, not torulose, (straight), (0.3–)0.4–0.8(–1) cm × (0.7–)1–1.5(–1.7) mm; valves glabrous or, sometimes, sparsely pubescent; septum margin broadly expanded basally (forming sacklike pouch around proximalmost seed in each locule); ovules 10–16 per ovary; style 0.5–1(–1.2) mm; stigma 2-lobed or entire. Seeds somewhat uniseriate, oblong, 1–1.4 × 0.5–0.9(–1) mm. 2n = 56.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Jul. |habitat=Limestone barrens |elevation=0-60 m |distribution=Nfld. and Labr. (Nfld.). |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Braya pilosa |accepted_authority=Hooker |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Fl. Bor.-Amer. |place=1: 65, plate 17A. 1830 |year=1830 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=C |label=Conservation concern }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Braya purpurascens subsp. pilosa |authority=(Hooker) Hultén |rank=subspecies }} |hierarchy=Brassicaceae;Brassicaceae tribe Euclidieae;Braya;Braya pilosa |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Brassicaceae]]
tribe[[Brassicaceae tribe Euclidieae]]
genus[[Braya]]
species[[Braya pilosa]]
|volume=Volume 7 |mention_page=page 546 |treatment_page=page 551 }}Plants scapose; moderately to densely lanate-pilose, trichomes simple and 2-forked. Stems simple or few to several from base, erect to ascending, (branched or unbranched), 0.4–1.1(–1.3) dm. Basal leaves: blade linear-spatulate, 0.7–2(–3) cm × 0.7–2.5(–3.5) mm, base (membranous), broadly expanded near point of attachment, margins entire, (ciliate, trichomes long, simple), apex obtuse, often with tuft of hairs. Cauline leaves: 0 or 1 (or a leaflike bract subtending proximalmost pedicel). Fruiting pedicels divaricate to erect, (1–)2.5–6 mm. Flowers: sepals 2.8–3.5 × (1.3–)1.6–2.5 mm; petals white, (obovate), 4.7–6.6 × 3–5.1 mm, (claw short, apex rounded); filaments 2–3 mm; anthers ovoid, 0.4–0.6 mm. Fruits ovoid or globose, not torulose, (0.4–)0.5–0.6 cm × (2.5–)3–4 mm; valves densely to moderately pubescent, trichomes relatively short, simple and 2-forked; septum margin not expanded, or not basally; ovules 14–20 per ovary; style 1.2–2(–2.5) mm; stigma (broadly expanded), strongly or weakly 2-lobed. Seeds biseriate, oblong, 0.7–0.9 × 0.4–0.6 mm.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Sandy, calcareous seashores |elevation=0-10 m |distribution=N.W.T. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

Braya pilosa is distinguished from other members of the genus by a combination of large flowers, broad fruits, and exceptionally long styles. This striking Braya was known from only three pre-1850 collections until the type locality near Cape Bathurst in the Northwest Territories was rediscovered in 2004. The species is apparently restricted to the type locality, where it is found on bare patches of soil disturbed by caribou hooves. Preliminary DNA sequence analyses indicate that it is most closely related to B. thorild-wulffii.

Field-Naturalist 118: 550–557. }} }}{{#Taxon: name=Braya pilosa |authority=Hooker |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Braya purpurascens subsp. pilosa |basionyms= |family=Brassicaceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Aug. |habitat=Sandy, calcareous seashores |elevation=0-10 m |distribution=N.W.T. |reference=harris2006a |publication title=Fl. Bor.-Amer. |publication year=1830 |special status=Endemic;Conservation concern |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V7/V7_881.xml |tribe=Brassicaceae tribe Euclidieae |genus=Braya |species=Braya pilosa }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Braya]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Braya thorild-wulffii |accepted_authority=Ostenfeld |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Meddel. Grønland |place=64: 176. 1923 |year=1923 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Braya pilosa subsp. thorild-wulffii |authority=(Ostenfeld) V. V. Petrovsky |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Braya purpurascens subsp. thorild-wulffii |authority=(Ostenfeld) Hultén |rank=subspecies }} {{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Braya purpurascens var. thorild-wulffii |authority=(Ostenfeld) B. Boivin |rank=variety }} |hierarchy=Brassicaceae;Brassicaceae tribe Euclidieae;Braya;Braya thorild-wulffii |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Brassicaceae]]
tribe[[Brassicaceae tribe Euclidieae]]
genus[[Braya]]
species[[Braya thorild-wulffii]]
|volume=Volume 7 |mention_page=page 546 |treatment_page=page 551 }}Plants scapose; densely pubescent throughout or glabrous, trichomes simple and 2-forked. Stems simple or few to several from base, decumbent to prostrate or, sometimes, ascending, (unbranched), (0.3–)0.5–0.9(–1.4) dm. Basal leaves: blade spatulate to linear-spatulate, (0.5–)1–3(–4) cm × 1–4 mm, base (membranous), broadly expanded near point of attachment, margins entire, (ciliate, trichomes long, mostly simple), apex obtuse, often with tuft of hairs. Cauline leaves: 0 or 1 (or a leaflike bract subtending proximalmost pedicel). Fruiting pedicels divaricate to erect, 1.5–4 mm. Flowers: sepals 2–3.5 × 1–2 mm; petals white to purplish, (narrowly spatulate), 2–3.7 × 1–1.5 mm, (claw and blade not differentiated), apex rounded; filaments 2–2.5(–3) mm; anthers ovoid, 0.4–0.6 mm. Fruits ovoid to globose, not torulose, (0.4–)0.5–0.8(–1) cm × (2.5–)3–5 mm; valves densely pubescent or glabrous, trichomes 2-forked and simple; septum margin not expanded, or not basally; ovules 16–30 per ovary; style obsolete to 0.7(–1) mm; stigma strongly 2-lobed or entire. Seeds biseriate, oblong, (1.1–)1.2–1.4(–1.5) × (0.5–)0.7–0.8(–1) mm.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=N.W.T.;Nunavut |discussion=

Subspecies 2 (2 in the flora).

|tables= |references= }}

Subspecies glabrata is known only from Banks and Victoria islands.

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Breynia |accepted_authority=J. R. Forster & G. Forster |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Char. Gen. Pl. ed. |place=2, 145, plate 73. 1776 |year=1776 |other_info_on_pub=name conserved }} |common_names=Snowbush |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=I |label=Introduced }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Phyllanthaceae;Breynia |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Phyllanthaceae]]
genus[[Breynia]]
|etymology=For Jacob Breyne, 1637–1697, and his son Johann Philipp Breyne, 1680–1764, Polish botanists |volume=Volume 12 |mention_page=page 328, 329, 346, 347 |treatment_page=page 345 }}Shrubs [trees], monoecious [dioecious], glabrous [hairy, hairs simple]; branching phyllanthoid. Leaves persistent, alternate, simple, scalelike on main stems, well developed on ultimate branchlets; stipules persistent [deciduous]; blade margins entire. Inflorescences unisexual, staminate proximal, few-flowered fascicles or flowers solitary, pistillate distal, flowers solitary. Pedicels present. Staminate flowers: sepals 6, connate throughout [connate basally to most of length], with scales at rim of calyx tube [near bases of lobes]; petals 0; nectary absent; stamens 3; filaments connate; connectives not extending beyond anthers; pistillode absent. Pistillate flowers: sepals persistent, 6, connate basally; petals 0; nectary absent; pistil 3-carpellate; styles 3, distinct, 2-fid. Fruits capsules. Seeds 2 per locule, rounded-trigonous; seed coat fleshy, smooth; caruncle absent. x = 13.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=Fla.;Asia;Indian Ocean Islands;Pacific Islands;Australia;introduced also in West Indies;Africa;tropical and subtropical regions. |introduced=true |discussion=

Species 10–30 (1 in the flora).

Breynia exhibits phyllanthoid branching (G. L. Webster 1956–1958), with well-developed leaves and flowers produced only on the deciduous ultimate branchlets and scalelike leaves on all other stems (referred to as main stems in this treatment). Like Glochidion and some Phyllanthus species, Breynia has a pollination mutualism with the moth genus Epicephala (reviewed in A. Kawakita and M. Kato 2009); see the discussion under 7. Glochidion for more information. Breynia is difficult taxonomically, hence the wide range in the number of species recognized within the genus.

Some Breynia species are grown as ornamental shrubs in tropical and subtropical areas; B. disticha is the most common and widespread.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Breynia |author=Geoffrey A. Levin |authority=J. R. Forster & G. Forster |rank=genus |parent rank=family |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Phyllanthaceae |distribution=Fla.;Asia;Indian Ocean Islands;Pacific Islands;Australia;introduced also in West Indies;Africa;tropical and subtropical regions. |introduced=true |reference=None |publication title=Char. Gen. Pl. ed. |publication year=1776 |special status=Introduced |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V12/V12_714.xml |genus=Breynia }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Phyllanthaceae]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Breynia disticha |accepted_authority=J. R. Forster & G. Forster |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Char. Gen. Pl. ed. |place=2, 146, plate 73. 1776 |year=1776 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=I |label=Introduced }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=F |label=Illustrated }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Breynia nivosa |authority=(W. Bull) Small |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Phyllanthaceae;Breynia;Breynia disticha |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Phyllanthaceae]]
genus[[Breynia]]
species[[Breynia disticha]]
|volume=Volume 12 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 346 }}Shrubs, 0.5–3 m. Leaves on main stems spiral. Leaves on ultimate branchlets distichous; petiole 2–4 mm; blade elliptic to ovate or suborbiculate, 1.5–4 × 1–3 cm, base obtuse to rounded, apex rounded. Pedicels: staminate 6–9 mm, pistillate 3–9 mm. Staminate flowers: calyx top-shaped, truncate, 1.5–3 mm. Pistillate flowers: sepals obovate, 1–5 mm. Capsules 5 mm diam., smooth. Seeds brown, 2–3 mm. 2n = 52 (Jamaica).{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering and fruiting summer. |habitat=Disturbed sites. |elevation=0–10 m. |distribution=Fla.;Pacific Islands;introduced also in West Indies;Indian Ocean Islands. |introduced=true |discussion=

Breynia disticha, native to New Caledonia and Vanuatu, is widely grown in tropical and subtropical areas and occasionally becomes naturalized. In the flora area, it is limited to scattered counties in southern Florida. Most plants are cultivars with variegated leaves in various shades of green, white, red, and pink; naturalized populations may revert to uniformly green leaves. The calyx typically reproduces the colors of the leaves, sometimes even being variegated.

Forster |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Breynia nivosa |basionyms= |family=Phyllanthaceae |phenology=Flowering and fruiting summer. |habitat=Disturbed sites. |elevation=0–10 m. |distribution=Fla.;Pacific Islands;introduced also in West Indies;Indian Ocean Islands. |introduced=true |reference=None |publication title=Char. Gen. Pl. ed. |publication year=1776 |special status=Introduced;Illustrated |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V12/V12_1102.xml |genus=Breynia |species=Breynia disticha }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Breynia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia |accepted_authority=Elliott |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Sketch Bot. S. Carolina |place=2: 290. 1823 |year=1823 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
|etymology=For John Brickell, 1748–1809, Irish-born physician and naturalist who settled in Georgia (not John Brickell, 1710?–1745, Irish naturalist who visited North Carolina ca. 1729–1731 and published on the natural history of North Carolina in 1737) |volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 460, 507 |treatment_page=page 491 }}Annuals, perennials, subshrubs, or shrubs, (12–)30–120(–200) cm. Stems mostly erect, often much branched (sometimes virgate, often striate). Leaves cauline; opposite or alternate; petiolate or sessile; blades usually 3-nerved from bases, deltate, lance-elliptic, lance-linear, lanceolate, lance-ovate, lance-rhombic, linear, oblong, obovate, ovate, rhombic-ovate, spatulate, or suborbiculate, margins mostly crenate, dentate, entire, laciniate-dentate, lobed, serrate, or toothed, faces glabrous (sometimes shiny) or glandular-puberulent, strigose, or tomentose, sometimes gland-dotted. Heads usually in corymbiform, sometimes cymiform, paniculiform, or racemiform, arrays, rarely borne singly. Involucres cylindric to obconic or campanulate, 5–12 mm diam. Phyllaries persistent, (10–)14–45(–60) in 3–7(–9) series, usually (4–)5–6(–16)-striate or -nerved, linear or lanceolate to oblanceolate or oblong, usually unequal (usually chartaceous, sometimes herbaceous). Receptacles flat to convex, epaleate. Florets (3–)8–45(–90); corollas usually white or whitish to cream, sometimes greenish, purplish or yellowish, throats mostly cylindric to narrowly funnelform (lengths 3–5 times diams.); styles: bases enlarged, hairy, branches narrowly clavate (± dilated distally). Cypselae narrowly prismatic, 10-ribbed, glabrous or hairy to glabrate, often gland-dotted; pappi persistent, of 10–80 usually smooth or barbellulate to barbellate, sometimes plumose or subplumose bristles in 1 series. x = 9.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=North America;Mexico;Central America. |discussion=

Species ca. 100 (32 in the flora).

|tables= |references={{Treatment/Reference |id=robinson1917a |text=Robinson, B. L. 1917. A monograph of the genus Brickellia. Mem. Gray Herb. 1: 3–151. }} }}

involucres 8–13 mm; phyllaries 18–24 |[[#key-0-26| > 26]] |-id=key-0-26 |26 |Leaf bases rounded to cordate (clasping); peduncles densely stipitate-glandular |[[Brickellia amplexicaulis|Brickellia amplexicaulis]] |-id=key-0-26 |26 |Leaf bases ± cuneate; peduncles densely tomentose, often gland-dotted as well |[[#key-0-27| > 27]] |-id=key-0-27 |27 |Phyllaries 18–22 in 5–7 series (lengths in outer 2–3series no more than 1/2 inner) |[[Brickellia cylindracea|Brickellia cylindracea]] |-id=key-0-27 |27 |Phyllaries 18–20 in 3–4(–5) series (lengths in outer series grading to inner) |[[Brickellia lemmonii|Brickellia lemmonii]] |-id=key-0-28 |28 |Leaf blades oblong or spatulate, 1–4 mm wide |[[Brickellia frutescens|Brickellia frutescens]] |-id=key-0-28 |28 |Leaf blades cordate, elliptic, lance-linear, lanceolate, lance-ovate, oblong, obovate, ovate, rhombic-ovate, subdeltate, or suborbiculate, (3–)10–100 mm wide |[[#key-0-29| > 29]] |-id=key-0-29 |29 |Florets 25–50; leaf blades elliptic, oblong, or lance-linear, margins entire |[[Brickellia oblongifolia|Brickellia oblongifolia]] |-id=key-0-29 |29 |Florets 8–25(–45); leaf blades cordate, lanceolate, lance-ovate, oblong, obovate, ovate, rhombic-ovate, or suborbiculate, margins entire or dentate |[[#key-0-30| > 30]] |-id=key-0-30 |30 |Leaf blades elliptic, lanceolate, lance-ovate, obovate, ovate, or subdeltate |[[#key-0-31| > 31]] |-id=key-0-30 |30 |Leaf blades mostly cordate or ovate to suborbiculate (if oblong, peduncles viscid or glandular-villous) |[[#key-0-33| > 33]] |-id=key-0-31 |31 |Shrubs; Scott |authority=Elliott |rank=genus |parent rank=tribe |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |distribution=North America;Mexico;Central America. |reference=robinson1917a |publication title=Sketch Bot. S. Carolina |publication year=1823 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1237.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia amplexicaulis |accepted_authority=B. L. Robinson |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |place=47: 199. 1911 |year=1911 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia amplexicaulis |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia amplexicaulis]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 493 }}Perennials, 100–200 cm. Stems branched from bases, pubescent and gland-dotted. Leaves opposite; petioles 0–1 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases (pinnately-veined distally), lanceolate to oblong, 40–160 × 10–75 mm, bases rounded to cordate (clasping), margins crenate to serrate, apices acute, faces densely to sparsely pubescent and stipitate-glandular. Heads in paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 7–25 mm, densely stipitate-glandular. Involucres cylindric to campanulate, 9–13 mm. Phyllaries 18–24 in 4–5 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 3–8-striate, unequal, margins narrowly scarious (apices acute to acuminate); outer ovate (6–8-striate, sparsely glandular at apices), inner narrowly lanceolate (3–4-striate, glabrous). Florets 13–22; corollas pale yellow or cream, often purple- or red-tinged, 6–8 mm. Cypselae 2.8–4 mm, densely pubescent to hirtellous; pappi of 35–60 white, barbellulate bristles.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Sep–Dec. |habitat=Rocky or grassy montane slopes, riparian habitats |elevation=700–1900 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex. |discussion=

Brickellia amplexicaulis is known from se Arizona and sw New Mexico.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia amplexicaulis |authority=B. L. Robinson |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Sep–Dec. |habitat=Rocky or grassy montane slopes, riparian habitats |elevation=700–1900 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex. |reference=None |publication title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |publication year=1911 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1238.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia amplexicaulis }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

revision.text:
{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia atractyloides |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |place=8: 290. 1870 |year=1870 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia atractyloides |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia atractyloides]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 491 |treatment_page=page 494 }}Shrubs, 20–50 cm. Stems densely branched, glandular-puberulent. Leaves opposite or alternate; petioles 0–3 mm; blades 3–4-nerved from bases (veins prominent), deltate, lanceolate, or ovate, 10–50 × 5–25 mm, bases acute to truncate or cordate, margins usually sharply dentate or dentate-serrate, rarely entire, apices acute to acuminate, faces glabrous or strigose and minutely glandular-puberulent. Heads in open, paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 10–70 mm, hispid to hispidulous and stipitate-glandular. Involucres cylindric to broadly campanulate, 9–15 mm. Phyllaries 24–33 in 3–4 series, green, 3–16-striate, subequal or unequal, margins narrowly scarious (apices acute to acuminate); outer (often bright green, 4–16-striate) lance-linear, linear-ovate, or broadly ovate, inner (pale green, 3–4-striate) linear or narrowly lanceolate (often chartaceous, scabrellous, often glandular). Florets 40–90; corollas pale yellow-green or cream, often purple-tinged, 6–8 mm. Cypselae 3–5.5 mm, scabrellous; pappi of 18–25 smooth or barbellulate bristles.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Nev.;Utah;nw Mexico. |discussion=

Varieties 3 (3 in the flora).

All three varieties of Brickellia atractyloides often intergrade and are not readily distinguished in some cases.

|tables= |references= }}
==Key==
{| class="wikitable fna-keytable" |-id=key-0-1 |1 |Phyllaries: outer broadly ovate |[[Brickellia atractyloides var. atractyloides|Brickellia atractyloides var. atractyloides]] |-id=key-0-1 |1 |Phyllaries: outer lance-ovate to lance-linear |[[#key-0-2| > 2]] |-id=key-0-2 |2 |Phyllaries, outer: margins ± entire |[[Brickellia atractyloides var. arguta|Brickellia atractyloides var. arguta]] |-id=key-0-2 |2 |Phyllaries, outer: margins dentate |[[Brickellia atractyloides var. odontolepis|Brickellia atractyloides var. odontolepis]] |}

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia atractyloides var. arguta |accepted_authority=(B. L. Robinson) Jepson |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Man. Fl. Pl. family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia atractyloides]]
variety[[Brickellia atractyloides var. arguta]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 494 }}Leaf blades ovate, 10–20 × 5–15 mm, margins dentate-serrate, faces strigose, often glandular-puberulent as well. Involucres 10–15 mm. Phyllaries: outer 6–10-striate, lance-ovate to lance-linear (often stipitate-glandular), margins ± entire, inner linear (± chartaceous). Florets 40–55; corollas cream, often purple-tinged. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Apr–Jun. |habitat=Desert mountain slopes, washes |elevation=100–1500 m |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Nev.;Mexico (Baja California). |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia atractyloides var. arguta |authority=(B. L. Robinson) Jepson |rank=variety |parent rank=species |synonyms= |basionyms=Brickellia arguta |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Apr–Jun. |habitat=Desert mountain slopes, washes |elevation=100–1500 m |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Nev.;Mexico (Baja California). |reference=None |publication title=Man. Fl. Pl. Calif., |publication year=1925 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1241.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia atractyloides |variety=Brickellia atractyloides var. arguta }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia atractyloides]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia atractyloides var. atractyloides |accepted_authority= |publications= |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia atractyloides;Brickellia atractyloides var. atractyloides |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia atractyloides]]
variety[[Brickellia atractyloides var. atractyloides]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 494 }}Leaf blades deltate, lanceolate, or ovate, 3- or 4-nerved from bases, 10–50 × 5–25 mm, margins sharply dentate or entire, apices acuminate, faces glabrous or minutely glandular-puberulent. Involucres 10–15 mm. Phyllaries: outer 7–16-striate, broadly ovate, margins entire, inner narrowly lanceolate. Florets 40–90; corollas pale yellow-green. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Mar–Sep. |habitat=Rock crevices, cliff faces, talus slopes, outwash fans |elevation=600–1600 m |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Nev.;Utah. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia atractyloides var. atractyloides |authority= |rank=variety |parent rank=species |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Mar–Sep. |habitat=Rock crevices, cliff faces, talus slopes, outwash fans |elevation=600–1600 m |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Nev.;Utah. |reference=None |publication title= |publication year= |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1240.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia atractyloides |variety=Brickellia atractyloides var. atractyloides }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia atractyloides]]

Calif., |place=1016. 1925 |year=1925 }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Brickellia arguta var. odontolepis |authority=B. L. Robinson |rank=variety |publication_title=Mem. Gray Herb. |publication_place=1: 103, fig. 79ß. 1917 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia atractyloides;Brickellia atractyloides var. odontolepis |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia atractyloides]]
variety[[Brickellia atractyloides var. odontolepis]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 494 }}Leaf blades ovate, 10–20 × 5–15 mm, margins dentate-serrate, faces strigose, often glandular-puberulent as well. Involucres 10–15 mm. Phyllaries: outer 5–12-striate, lance-ovate to lance-linear, margins dentate, inner linear (± chartaceous). Florets 40–55; corollas cream, often purple-tinged.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Apr–Jun. |habitat=Desert mountain slopes, washes |elevation=100–1500 m |distribution=Calif.;Mexico (Baja California). |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia atractyloides var. odontolepis |authority=(B. L. Robinson) Jepson |rank=variety |parent rank=species |synonyms= |basionyms=Brickellia arguta var. odontolepis |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Apr–Jun. |habitat=Desert mountain slopes, washes |elevation=100–1500 m |distribution=Calif.;Mexico (Baja California). |reference=None |publication title=Man. Fl. Pl. Calif., |publication year=1925 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1242.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia atractyloides |variety=Brickellia atractyloides var. odontolepis }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia atractyloides]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia baccharidea |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |place=3(5): 87. 1852 |year=1852 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=C |label=Conservation concern }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia baccharidea |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia baccharidea]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 492 |treatment_page=page 494 }}Shrubs, 100–150 cm. Stems (ascending) branched, pubescent, sometimes glandular-pubescent. Leaves alternate; petioles 4–10 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, rhombic-ovate, 10–40 × 10–20 mm, bases cuneate, margins laciniate-dentate, apices acute to obtuse, faces glabrate or gland-dotted. Heads in dense, paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 5–40 mm, pubescent. Involucres narrowly campanulate, 7–11 mm. Phyllaries 35–40 in 5–7 series, 3–5-striate, unequal, (glabrous, ± chartaceous) margins narrowly scarious (apices acute to acuminate); outer ovate, inner lanceolate. Florets 16–17; corollas cream, 6–7 mm. Cypselae 2–3 mm, pubescent; pappi of 18–24 white, barbellate bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Oct–Apr. |habitat=Sandy to granitic soils, limestone slopes, granitic cliffs |elevation=500–1600 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Tex. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia baccharidea |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Oct–Apr. |habitat=Sandy to granitic soils, limestone slopes, granitic cliffs |elevation=500–1600 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Tex. |reference=None |publication title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |publication year=1852 |special status=Endemic;Conservation concern |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1243.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia baccharidea }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia betonicifolia |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |place=5(6): 72. 1853 |year=1853 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia betonicifolia |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia betonicifolia]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 492 |treatment_page=page 495 }}Perennials, 30–90 cm. Stems branched from bases, pubescent. Leaves opposite; petioles 1–5 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, oblong, obovate, or ovate, (15–)30–80 × 10–35 mm, bases cordate or truncate, margins crenate-serrate, apices acute to obtuse, faces sparsely pubescent and gland-dotted. Heads erect, usually in loose, paniculiform arrays, sometimes borne singly. Peduncles 2–15 mm, hispid to hirsute. Involucres cylindric to narrowly campanulate, 8–12 mm. Phyllaries 17–20 in 3–5 series, pale green, often purplish, 5–9-striate, unequal, margins narrowly scarious-ciliate (apices acute to acuminate); outer lance-ovate (sparsely pubescent), inner narrowly lanceolate (glabrous). Florets 10–16; corollas purplish, 7–9 mm. Cypselae 3–4 mm, densely pubescent to velutinous; pappi of 40–52 white, barbellate bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Oct. |habitat=Oak woodlands, open limestone hillsides |elevation=1500–2000 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Mexico. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia betonicifolia |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Oct. |habitat=Oak woodlands, open limestone hillsides |elevation=1500–2000 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Mexico. |reference=None |publication title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |publication year=1853 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1244.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia betonicifolia }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia brachyphylla |accepted_authority=(A. Gray) A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |place=3(5): 84. 1852 |year=1852 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Clavigera brachyphylla |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |publication_title=Mem. Amer. Acad. Arts, n. s. |publication_place=4: 63. 1849 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia brachyphylla |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia brachyphylla]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 491 |treatment_page=page 495 }}Perennials, 30–100 cm (caudices woody). Stems branched, pubescent. Leaves mostly alternate (sometimes subopposite); petioles 0–3 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, lanceolate or lance-ovate, 10–50 × 4–20 mm, bases acute to obtuse, margins serrate or entire, apices acute, faces sparsely to densely pubescent, often gland-dotted or stipitate-glandular. Heads usually in open, racemiform or paniculiform arrays, rarely borne singly. Peduncles 4–20 mm, pubescent. Involucres cylindric to campanulate, 8–11 mm. Phyllaries 15–20 in 4–5 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 5–9-striate, unequal, margins narrowly scarious (often ciliate, apices acute to acuminate or subaristate); outer lance-ovate (often puberulent), inner narrowly lanceolate (glabrous). Florets 9–12; corollas pale yellow-green, often purple-tinged, 4.5–6 mm. Cypselae 2.5–5.3 mm, mostly velutinous, sometimes pubescent; pappi of 27–32 white, usually plumose, rarely barbellate, bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Oct. |habitat=Limestone cliffs, rhyolitic rock, rocky ridges, canyon walls, hillsides |elevation=1400–2400 m |distribution=Ariz.;Colo.;Kans.;N.Mex.;Tex. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia brachyphylla |authority=(A. Gray) A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms=Clavigera brachyphylla |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Oct. |habitat=Limestone cliffs, rhyolitic rock, rocky ridges, canyon walls, hillsides |elevation=1400–2400 m |distribution=Ariz.;Colo.;Kans.;N.Mex.;Tex. |reference=None |publication title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |publication year=1852 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1245.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia brachyphylla }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia californica |accepted_authority=(Torrey & A. Gray) A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Mem. Amer. Acad. Arts, n. s. |place=4: 64. 1849 |year=1849 }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Bulbostylis californica |authority=Torrey & A. Gray |rank=species |publication_title=Fl. N. Amer. |publication_place=2: 79. 1841 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia californica |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia californica]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 492, 502, 504 |treatment_page=page 495 }}Shrubs, 50–200 cm. Stems branched from near bases, glandular-pubescent. Leaves alternate; petioles 5–60+ mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, ovate to deltate, 10–100 × 10–90 mm, bases cordate to truncate, margins crenate to serrate, apices acute to rounded, faces puberulent to glabrate, often gland-dotted. Heads borne in (leafy) paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 1–5 mm, glandular-pubescent. Involucres cylindric to obconic, 7–12 mm. Phyllaries 21–35 in 5–6 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 3–4-striate, unequal, margins scarious; outer ovate to lance-ovate (glabrous or sparsely glandular-pubescent, apices acute to acuminate), inner lanceolate (glabrous, apices obtuse to acuminate). Florets 8–12; corollas pale yellow-green, 5.5–8 mm. Cypselae 2.5–3.5 mm, puberulent; pappi of 24–30 white, barbellate bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Oct. |habitat=Dry, rocky hillsides, arroyos, canyons |elevation=800–2700 m |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Nev.;N.Mex.;Okla.;Tex.;Utah;Wyo. |discussion=

Floret number of 18 is reported for Brickellia californica in most floras; A. Cronquist (1994) noted that 18 is high by his count; he reported 12 as the maximum number for the specimens he sampled and that fits the specimens I have counted from Arizona.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia californica |authority=(Torrey & A. Gray) A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms=Bulbostylis californica |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Oct. |habitat=Dry, rocky hillsides, arroyos, canyons |elevation=800–2700 m |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Nev.;N.Mex.;Okla.;Tex.;Utah;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Mem. Amer. Acad. Arts, n. s. |publication year=1849 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1246.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia californica }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia chenopodina |accepted_authority=(Greene) B. L. Robinson |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Mem. Gray Herb. |place=1: 99. 1917 |year=1917 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=C |label=Conservation concern }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Coleosanthus chenopodinus |authority=Greene |rank=species |publication_title=Contr. U.S. Natl. Herb. |publication_place=16: 177. 1913 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia chenopodina |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia chenopodina]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 492, 496 |treatment_page=page 495 }}Perennials, 100–150 cm (bases woody). Stems branched, stipitate-glandular. Leaves alternate; petioles 4–10 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, rhombic-ovate to lanceolate, 20–50 × 10–40 mm, bases rounded to cuneate, margins entire or irregularly dentate, apices acute, faces glabrous or sparsely gland-dotted. Heads borne singly (terminating lateral branches). Peduncles (leafy) 5–50 mm, stipitate-glandular. Involucres cylindric to campanulate, 8–9 mm. Phyllaries 22–26 in 5–6 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 3–4-striate, subequal or unequal, margins narrowly scarious; outer lanceolate to lance-ovate (often herbaceous, glandular-hirtellous, equaling or surpassing inner, apices acute to long-attenuate), inner lanceolate to lance-linear (glabrous, apices obtuse to acute). Florets 18–24; corollas pale yellow-green or greenish white, 5–6 mm. Cypselae 2.5–3 mm, strigose; pappi of 30–35 white, smooth or barbellulate bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Aug–Oct. |habitat=Near streams, canyon bottoms |elevation=1300–1600 m |distribution=N.Mex. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

Brickellia chenopodina is known only from Grants County; it is similar in most respects to B. floribunda and may be little more than a shade form of the latter, with which it is sympatric.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia chenopodina |authority=(Greene) B. L. Robinson |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms=Coleosanthus chenopodinus |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Aug–Oct. |habitat=Near streams, canyon bottoms |elevation=1300–1600 m |distribution=N.Mex. |reference=None |publication title=Mem. Gray Herb. |publication year=1917 |special status=Endemic;Conservation concern |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1247.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia chenopodina }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia cordifolia |accepted_authority=Elliott |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Sketch Bot. S. Carolina |place=2: 290. 1823 |year=1823 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=C |label=Conservation concern }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Coleosanthus cordifolius |authority=(Elliott) Kuntze |rank=species }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia cordifolia |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia cordifolia]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 492 |treatment_page=page 496 }}Perennials, 50–150 cm (caudices slender). Stems branched, pubescent. Leaves opposite; petioles 10–40 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, deltate-ovate to lance-ovate, 30–150 × 20–100 mm, bases subtruncate to cordate, margins coarsely to finely serrate, apices acuminate, abaxial faces minutely pubescent and gland-dotted, adaxial faces sparsely puberulent. Heads (erect in flower and fruit) in corymbiform or paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 10–25 mm, glandular-pubescent. Involucres broadly campanulate, 10–12 mm. Phyllaries 28–35 in 4–5 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 4–7-striate, unequal to subequal, margins scarious (ciliate); outer narrowly lanceolate to lance-ovate (glandular-pubescent, apices long-acuminate), mid lanceolate (apices acute to acuminate), inner narrowly lanceolate (apices acute to obtuse, recurved, pubescent, often gland-dotted). Florets 35–45; corollas pale yellow-green, often purple-tinged, 6–7.2 mm. Cypselae 4.5–5.5 mm, hispidulous to glabrate; pappi of 38–46 purple-tinged, barbellate bristles.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Aug–Oct. |habitat=Moist pine and oak woodlands |elevation=10–100 m |distribution=Ala.;Fla.;Ga. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia cordifolia |authority=Elliott |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms=Coleosanthus cordifolius |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Aug–Oct. |habitat=Moist pine and oak woodlands |elevation=10–100 m |distribution=Ala.;Fla.;Ga. |reference=None |publication title=Sketch Bot. S. Carolina |publication year=1823 |special status=Endemic;Conservation concern |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1248.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia cordifolia }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

revision.text:
{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia coulteri |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |place=3(5): 86. 1852 |year=1852 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia coulteri |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia coulteri]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 492 |treatment_page=page 496 }}Shrubs, 30–150 cm. Stems much branched from bases, pubescent, often gland-dotted. Leaves opposite; petioles 4–12 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, broadly ovate to deltate, 10–60 × 10–30 mm, bases truncate, hastate, or subcordate, margins usually toothed (1–3 sets of sharp teeth near bases), rarely subentire, apices attenuate, faces minutely pubescent. Heads in loose, paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 5–40 mm, pubescent and sometimes gland-dotted. Involucres cylindric to campanulate, 8–12 mm. Phyllaries 17–22 in 4–6 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 4–5-striate, unequal, margins scarious (apices acute to acuminate or mucronate, minutely pubescent); outer lance-ovate to narrowly lanceolate (glabrous or sparsely pubescent), inner narrowly lanceolate to linear (glabrous). Florets 13–25; corollas pale yellow-green, often purple-tinged, 7–8.2 mm. Cypselae 3–5 mm, hispidulous, strigose, or glandular-pubescent; pappi of 28–40 smooth or barbellulate bristles.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Tex.;n Mexico. |discussion=

Varieties 3 (2 in the flora}.

|tables= |references= }}
==Key==
{| class="wikitable fna-keytable" |-id=key-0-1 |1 |Midstem leaf blades mostly 40–60 mm; peduncles mostly 15–40 mm, mostly glandular-pubescent |[[Brickellia coulteri var. coulteri|Brickellia coulteri var. coulteri]] |-id=key-0-1 |1 |Midstem leaf blades mostly 20–40(–50) mm; peduncles 5–25 mm, pubescent, mostly lacking glandular hairs |[[Brickellia coulteri var. brachiata|Brickellia coulteri var. brachiata]] |}
{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia coulteri |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Tex.;n Mexico. |reference=None |publication title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |publication year=1852 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1249.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia coulteri }} [[Category:Treatment]] [[Category:Brickellia]] [[Category:Revised Since Print]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia coulteri var. brachiata |accepted_authority=(A. Gray) B. L. Turner |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Phytologia |place=68: 237. 1990 |year=1990 }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Brickellia brachiata |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |publication_title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |publication_place=21: 385. 1886 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia coulteri;Brickellia coulteri var. brachiata |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia coulteri]]
variety[[Brickellia coulteri var. brachiata]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 497 }}Leaf blades 10–40(–50) × 10–20 mm, midstem blades mostly 20–40(–50) mm. Peduncles 5–25 mm, pubescent, mostly lacking glandular hairs. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Mar–Oct. |habitat=Open sandy areas, arid rocky slopes, desert canyons |elevation=400–2000 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Tex.;Mexico. |discussion=

Variety brachiata includes most specimens from Arizona, except those from lower side canyons of the Grand Canyon. Those plants are strongly gland-dotted and often have larger leaves characteristic of the type variety. Some plants from southeastern Arizona are not clearly differentiated.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia coulteri var. brachiata |authority=(A. Gray) B. L. Turner |rank=variety |parent rank=species |synonyms= |basionyms=Brickellia brachiata |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Mar–Oct. |habitat=Open sandy areas, arid rocky slopes, desert canyons |elevation=400–2000 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Tex.;Mexico. |reference=None |publication title=Phytologia |publication year=1990 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1251.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia coulteri |variety=Brickellia coulteri var. brachiata }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia coulteri]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia coulteri var. coulteri |accepted_authority= |publications= |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia coulteri;Brickellia coulteri var. coulteri |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia coulteri]]
variety[[Brickellia coulteri var. coulteri]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page= |treatment_page=page 497 }}Leaf blades 20–60 × 10–30 mm, midstem blades mostly 40–60 mm. Peduncles mostly 15–40 mm, mostly glandular-pubescent. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Mar–Oct. |habitat=Open sandy areas, arid rocky slopes, desert canyons |elevation=10–1000 m |distribution=Ariz.;Tex.;Mexico. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia coulteri var. coulteri |authority= |rank=variety |parent rank=species |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Mar–Oct. |habitat=Open sandy areas, arid rocky slopes, desert canyons |elevation=10–1000 m |distribution=Ariz.;Tex.;Mexico. |reference=None |publication title= |publication year= |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1250.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia coulteri |variety=Brickellia coulteri var. coulteri }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia coulteri]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia cylindracea |accepted_authority=A. Gray & Engelmann |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |place=1: 46. 1847 |year=1847 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia cylindracea |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia cylindracea]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 493 |treatment_page=page 497 }}Perennials, 40–120 cm (caudices woody). Stems branched, pubescent, gland-dotted. Leaves mostly opposite, sometimes alternate or subopposite; petioles 0–3 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, lanceolate to obovate, 20–60 × 12–30 mm, bases ± cuneate, margins crenate to serrate, apices obtuse to acute, abaxial faces tomentose, often densely gland-dotted as well (venation raised, reticulate), adaxial faces pubescent and gland-dotted. Heads in ± dense, racemiform or paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 2–15 mm, densely tomentose, often gland-dotted. Involucres cylindric to campanulate, 8–13 mm. Phyllaries 18–22 in 5–7 series, greenish, often purplish-tinged, 6–8-striate, unequal, margins scarious (apices acute to acuminate); outer ovate (sparsely villous, gland-dotted, lengths no more than 1/2 inner, margins long-ciliate), inner narrowly lanceolate to linear-oblong (glabrous). Florets 10–21; corollas greenish, yellow, or yellow-orange, often purple-tinged, 5–7 mm. Cypselae 3.5–5 mm, sparsely to densely pubescent; pappi of 30–35, white to tawny, barbellate bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Nov. |habitat=Dry limestone hillsides |elevation=100–600 m |distribution=Tex. |discussion=

L. D. Flyr (1970) rightly noted that Brickellia cylindracea is variable in leaf size, shape, and texture as well as arrangements of heads, and added that it is not easily distinguished from B. conduplicata (= B. lemmonii var. conduplicata), which accounts for most of the specimens in west Texas. Brickellia cylindracea has a more eastern distribution than B. lemmonii var. conduplicata and appears to have a strong preference for limestone soils. Some specimens from limestone outcrops in west Texas blur distinction between the two species.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia cylindracea |authority=A. Gray & Engelmann |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jun–Nov. |habitat=Dry limestone hillsides |elevation=100–600 m |distribution=Tex. |reference=None |publication title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |publication year=1847 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1252.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia cylindracea }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia dentata |accepted_authority=(de Candolle) Schultz-Bipontinus |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=in B. Seemann, Bot. Voy. Herald, |place=301. 1856 |year=1856 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Clavigera dentata |authority=de Candolle |rank=species |publication_title=in A. P. de Candolle and A. L. P. P. de Candolle, Prodr. |publication_place=5: 128. 1836 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia dentata |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia dentata]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 493 |treatment_page=page 497 }}Shrubs, 60–120 cm. Stems branched from bases, puberulent, sparsely gland-dotted. Leaves alternate; petioles 1–2 mm; blades obscurely 3-nerved from bases, lanceolate to lance-ovate, 5–40 × 3.5–12 mm, bases acute to cuneate, margins usually coarsely dentate, sometimes entire, apices acute, faces gland-dotted. Heads in (elongate) paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 1–2 mm, puberulent, gland-dotted. Involucres cylindric to campanulate, 7–11 mm. Phyllaries 18–22 in 5–6 series, greenish or stramineous, 3–5-striate, unequal, margins scarious (apices acute to obtuse, ciliate); outer ovate (glandular-pubescent), inner lanceolate (gland-dotted). Florets 13–20; corollas pale green or yellow, 4.5–6.5 mm. Cypselae 3.5–4 mm, usually glabrous, rarely sparsely pubescent; pappi of 30–35 tawny, usually barbellate, sometimes subplumose, bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Aug–Nov. |habitat=Gravel of limestone streambeds |elevation=100–400 m |distribution=Tex. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia dentata |authority=(de Candolle) Schultz-Bipontinus |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms=Clavigera dentata |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Aug–Nov. |habitat=Gravel of limestone streambeds |elevation=100–400 m |distribution=Tex. |reference=None |publication title=in B. Seemann, Bot. Voy. Herald, |publication year=1856 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1253.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia dentata }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia desertorum |accepted_authority=Coville |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Proc. Biol. Soc. Wash. |place=7: 68. 1892 |year=1892 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia desertorum |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia desertorum]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 492, 493 |treatment_page=page 498 }}Shrubs, 80–200 cm. Stems intricately branched, densely puberulent, often gland-dotted. Leaves opposite or alternate; petioles 1–2.5 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, ovate, 3–13 × 4–14 mm, bases obtuse to truncate, margins crenate-serrate, apices obtuse, faces gland-dotted and tomentulose to densely puberulent. Heads in paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 0–3 mm, gland-dotted. Involucres cylindric, 8–10 mm. Phyllaries 20–24 in 4–7 series, greenish or brownish, 3–4-striate, unequal, margins scarious (apices acute to apiculate); outer broadly ovate (granular-puberulent), inner lanceolate to lance-linear (glabrous or tomentulose, often gland-dotted). Florets 8–12; corollas white, 4.5–5 mm. Cypselae 2–3 mm, scabrous; pappi of 12–15 white, smooth or barbellulate bristles.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Sep–Mar. |habitat=Dry hillsides, outwash slopes, canyons |elevation=200–1400 m |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Nev.;Mexico;West Indies;Central America (to Nicaragua). |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia desertorum |authority=Coville |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Sep–Mar. |habitat=Dry hillsides, outwash slopes, canyons |elevation=200–1400 m |distribution=Ariz.;Calif.;Nev.;Mexico;West Indies;Central America (to Nicaragua). |reference=None |publication title=Proc. Biol. Soc. Wash. |publication year=1892 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1254.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia desertorum }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia eupatorioides |accepted_authority=(Linnaeus) Shinners |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Sida |place=4: 274. 1971 |year=1971 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=F |label=Illustrated }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Kuhnia eupatorioides |authority=Linnaeus |rank=species |publication_title=Sp. Pl. ed. |publication_place=2, 2: 1662. 1763 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia eupatorioides |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia eupatorioides]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 466, 491 |treatment_page=page 498 }}Perennials, 30–200 cm (bases woody). Stems branched, pubescent. Leaves mostly opposite (alternate in vars. gracillima and texana); petioles 0–10 mm; blades 1- or 3-nerved from bases, lanceolate, lance-linear, lance-ovate, lance-rhombic, linear, or oblong, 25–100 × 0.5–40 mm, bases acute, margins entire or ± dentate (often revolute), apices obtuse to acuminate, faces glandular-pubescent. Heads in paniculiform or corymbiform arrays. Peduncles 5–100 mm, glandular-pubescent. Involucres cylindric to narrowly campanulate, 7–15 mm. Phyllaries 22–26 in 4–6 series, green to stramineous, sometimes purple-tinged, 3–7-striate, unequal, margins scarious (often ciliate); outer ovate to lance-ovate (puberulent, often densely gland-dotted, apices acute to acuminate), inner lanceolate (± gland-dotted, apices obtuse to aristate). Florets 6–35; corollas pale yellow, yellow-green, pinkish lavender, or maroon, 4.5–6 mm. Cypselae 2.7–5.5 mm, glabrous or strigose, sometimes hispidulous or velutinous and/or gland-dotted; pappi of 20–28 white or tawny, usually plumose or subplumose, sometimes barbellate, bristles.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=Ala.;Ariz.;Ark.;Colo.;Fla.;Ga.;Ill.;Ind.;Iowa;Kans.;Ky.;La.;Md.;Mich.;Minn.;Miss.;Mo.;Mont.;N.C.;N.Dak.;N.J.;N.Mex.;Nebr.;Ohio;Okla.;Pa.;S.C.;S.Dak.;Tenn.;Tex.;Utah;Va.;W.Va.;Wis.;Mexico. |discussion=

Varieties 6 (6 in the flora).

|tables= |references= }}

|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 498 |treatment_page=page 499 }}Plants 30–150 cm. Leaves opposite; petioles 0–1 mm; blades 1-nerved from bases, lance-linear to linear, 5–90 × 1.5–9 mm, margins entire. Heads in paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 10–100 mm. Involucres 8–13 mm. Phyllaries greenish, sometimes purple-tinged (apices obtuse to acuminate). Florets 16–30; corollas pale yellow-green to pinkish lavender, 4.7–8 mm. Cypselae 4–5 mm. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Oct. |habitat=Open areas, wide range of soils |elevation=400–1400 m |distribution=Ariz.;Colo.;N.Mex.;Tex.;Utah;Mexico. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia eupatorioides var. chlorolepis |authority=(Wooton & Standley) B. |volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 498 |treatment_page=page 499 }}Plants 30–200 cm. Leaves opposite; petioles 0–10 mm; blades 1- or 3-nerved from bases, lanceolate to lance-linear, 5–90 × 2–15 mm, margins entire or coarsely dentate. Heads in paniculiform or corymbiform arrays. Peduncles 5–25 mm. Involucres 8–15 mm. Phyllaries green to stramineous, sometimes purple-tinged (lengths of outer to 1/2 inner, apices acute to acuminate, not contorted). Florets 15–35; corollas pale yellow to pinkish lavender, 4.7–8 mm. Cypselae 2.7–5 mm. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Oct. |habitat=Open areas, wide range of soils |elevation=200–2300 m |distribution=Ark.;Colo.;Ill.;Ind.;Iowa;Kans.;Mich.;Minn.;Mo.;Mont.;Nebr.;N.Mex.;N.Dak.;S.Dak.;Tex.;Wis. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia eupatorioides var. corymbulosa |authority=(Torrey & A. Leaves opposite; petioles 1–10 mm; blades 1- or 3-nerved from bases, broadly rhombic-lanceolate to narrowly lanceolate, 25–100 × 5–40 mm, margins entire or ± dentate. Heads in corymbiform arrays. Peduncles 5–20 mm. Involucres 7–11 mm. Phyllaries green to stramineous, sometimes purple-tinged (lengths of outer to 1/2 inner, apices acute to acuminate, not contorted). Florets 6–15; corollas pale yellow to maroon, 4.5–6 mm. Cypselae 4–5.5 mm. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering May–Oct. |habitat=Open areas, wide range of soils |elevation=200–2300 m |distribution=Ala.;Ark.;Fla.;Ga.;Ind.;Ky.;La.;Md.;Miss.;N.J.;N.C.;Ohio;Pa.;S.C.;Tenn.;Tex.;Va.;W.Va. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia eupatorioides var. eupatorioides |authority= |rank=variety |parent rank=species |synonyms=Kuhnia glutinosa |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering May–Oct. |habitat=Open areas, wide range of soils |elevation=200–2300 m |distribution=Ala.;Ark.;Fla.;Ga.;Ind.;Ky.;La.;Md.;Miss.;N.J.;N.C.;Ohio;Pa.;S.C.;Tenn.;Tex.;Va.;W.Va. |reference=None |publication title= |publication year= |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1256.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia eupatorioides |variety=Brickellia eupatorioides var. eupatorioides }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia eupatorioides]]

|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 498 |treatment_page=page 499 }}Plants 30–70 cm. Leaves opposite; petioles 0–2 mm; blades 1- or, obscurely, 3-nerved from bases, narrowly oblong to linear, 5–40 × 1–3.5 mm, margins entire. Heads in paniculiform or corymbiform arrays. Peduncles 5–60 mm. Involucres 7–11 mm. Phyllaries green to stramineous, sometimes purple-tinged. Florets 9–13; corollas pale yellow to maroon, 6–6.5 mm. Cypselae 3.5–5 mm.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jun–Sep. |habitat=Piney woods |elevation=10–50+ m |distribution=Fla. |discussion=

Of conservation concern.

Variety floridana is known only from southern Florida.

Cypselae 4–5 mm. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Aug–Nov. |habitat=Open areas, wide range of soils |elevation=50–1000 m |distribution=Ark.;Kans.;Mo.;Okla.;Tex. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia eupatorioides var. texana |authority=(Shinners) Shinners |rank=variety |parent rank=species |synonyms=Brickellia eupatorioides var. ozarkana;K. eupatorioides var. ozarkana |basionyms=Kuhnia eupatorioides var. texana |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Aug–Nov. |habitat=Open areas, wide range of soils |elevation=50–1000 m |distribution=Ark.;Kans.;Mo.;Okla.;Tex. |reference=None |publication title=Sida |publication year=1971 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1261.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia eupatorioides |variety=Brickellia eupatorioides var. texana }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia eupatorioides]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia floribunda |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |place=5(6): 73. 1853 |year=1853 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia floribunda |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia floribunda]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 492, 496 |treatment_page=page 500 }}Perennials, 100–200 cm (bases woody). Stems branched, stipitate-glandular. Leaves alternate; petioles 20–35 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, deltate-ovate or rhombic-ovate, 20–140 × 10–100 mm, bases truncate to cordate, margins irregularly dentate, apices acute, faces gland-dotted or glandular-pubescent. Heads in paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 3–18 mm, stipitate-glandular. Involucres cylindric to campanulate, 7.5–8.5 mm. Phyllaries 22–26 in 5–6 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 3–4-striate, unequal, margins narrowly scarious (apices obtuse to acute); outer ovate to lanceolate (glandular-hirtellous, shorter than inner), inner linear-lanceolate (glabrous). Florets 15–24; corollas pale yellow-green or greenish white, 5–6.5 mm. Cypselae 2–3 mm, strigose; pappi of 30–35 white, barbellulate bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Aug–Oct. |habitat=Near streams, canyon bottoms |elevation=1100–1800 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Mexico. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia floribunda |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Aug–Oct. |habitat=Near streams, canyon bottoms |elevation=1100–1800 m |distribution=Ariz.;N.Mex.;Mexico. |reference=None |publication title=Smithsonian Contr. Knowl. |publication year=1853 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1262.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia floribunda }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia frutescens |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |place=17: 207. 1882 |year=1882 }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia frutescens |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia frutescens]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 493 |treatment_page=page 500 }}Shrubs, 30–60 cm. Stems intricately branched, hirtellous, sparsely gland-dotted. Leaves alternate; petioles 1–2 mm; blades (venation obscure) oblong to spatulate, 3–12 × 1–4 mm, bases acute to acuminate, margins entire, apices acute to obtuse, faces tomentose, gland-dotted. Heads in paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 10–30 mm, villous, gland-dotted. Involucres cylindric, 9–11 mm. Phyllaries 20–25 in 5–6 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 4–5-striate, unequal, (sparsely villous, gland-dotted) margins narrowly scarious (apices rounded, mucronate); outer ovate to lanceolate (ciliate), inner linear-oblong. Florets 20–30; corollas purplish, 6.5–7.5 mm. Cypselae 3.5–4.8 mm, hispidulous; pappi of 26–30 white, barbellulate bristles.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Mar–Jun. |habitat=Granitic desert slopes or sands |elevation=600–1200 m |distribution=Calif.;Nev.;Mexico (Baja California). |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia frutescens |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Mar–Jun. |habitat=Granitic desert slopes or sands |elevation=600–1200 m |distribution=Calif.;Nev.;Mexico (Baja California). |reference=None |publication title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |publication year=1882 |special status= |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1263.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia frutescens }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia grandiflora |accepted_authority=(Hooker) Nuttall |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Trans. Amer. Philos. Soc., n. s. |place=7: 287. 1840 |year=1840 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=F |label=Illustrated }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms={{Treatment/ID/Basionym |name=Eupatorium grandiflorum |authority=Hooker |rank=species |publication_title=Fl. Bor.-Amer. |publication_place=2: 26. 1834 }} |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia grandiflora |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia grandiflora]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 491, 492 |treatment_page=page 500 }}Perennials, 30–95 cm (taproots thickened). Stems branched, puberulent. Leaves opposite or alternate; petioles 10–70 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, deltate-ovate, lance-ovate, or subcordate, 15–120 × 20–70 mm, bases acute, truncate, or subcordate, margins crenate, dentate, or serrate, apices attenuate, faces puberulent and gland-dotted. Heads (nodding in flower and fruit) in loose, corymbiform or paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 4–30 mm, pubescent. Involucres cylindric or obconic, 7–12 mm. Phyllaries 30–40 in 5–7 series, greenish, 4–5-striate, unequal, margins scarious; outer lance-ovate to lanceolate (pubescent, margins ciliate, apices long-acuminate), inner lanceolate to lance-linear (glabrous, apices acute to acuminate). Florets mostly 20–40(–70); corollas pale yellow-green, 6.5–7.5 mm. Cypselae 4–5 mm, hispidulous to hirtellous; pappi of 20–30 white, barbellate bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Oct. |habitat=Rocky hillsides, shaded forests, dry slopes, canyons |elevation=1200–3000 m |distribution=Ariz.;Ark.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Kans.;Mo.;Mont.;Nebr.;Nev.;N.Mex.;Oreg.;Tex.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia grandiflora |authority=(Hooker) Nuttall |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms=Eupatorium grandiflorum |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Oct. |habitat=Rocky hillsides, shaded forests, dry slopes, canyons |elevation=1200–3000 m |distribution=Ariz.;Ark.;Calif.;Colo.;Idaho;Kans.;Mo.;Mont.;Nebr.;Nev.;N.Mex.;Oreg.;Tex.;Utah;Wash.;Wyo. |reference=None |publication title=Trans. Amer. Philos. Soc., n. s. |publication year=1840 |special status=Illustrated;Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1264.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia grandiflora }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia greenei |accepted_authority=A. Gray |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |place=12: 58. 1877 |year=1877 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }} |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia greenei |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia greenei]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 491, 501 |treatment_page=page 500 }}Perennials, 20–50 cm (caudices woody). Stems branched, villous, stipitate-glandular. Leaves alternate; petioles 0–2 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, ovate, 15–30 × 5–25 mm, bases rounded to truncate, margins evenly to irregularly serrate, apices acute, faces viscid-glandular. Heads borne singly or in open, cymiform arrays (each head subtended by leaflike bracts). Peduncles 0–2 mm. Involucres broadly cylindric to campanulate, 14–18 mm. Phyllaries (24–)36–42 in (3–)5–7 series, greenish or stramineous, often purple-tinged, 3–5-striate, unequal, margins narrowly scarious (apices acute to long-acuminate); outer lance-ovate to lanceolate (sparsely gland-dotted), inner narrowly lanceolate (glabrous). Florets 44–60; corollas yellow-green, often purple-tinged, 8–10 mm. Cypselae 5.5–7 mm, glabrate to hispidulous; pappi of 20–30 white, barbellate bristles. 2n = 18.{{Treatment/Body |phenology=Flowering Jul–Sep. |habitat=Open rocky slopes, canyon bottoms, riparian areas, serpentine soils |elevation=800–2200 m |distribution=Calif.;Oreg. |discussion=

A sweet odor is often associated with Brickellia greenei.

|tables= |references= }}{{#Taxon: name=Brickellia greenei |authority=A. Gray |rank=species |parent rank=genus |synonyms= |basionyms= |family=Asteraceae |phenology=Flowering Jul–Sep. |habitat=Open rocky slopes, canyon bottoms, riparian areas, serpentine soils |elevation=800–2200 m |distribution=Calif.;Oreg. |reference=None |publication title=Proc. Amer. Acad. Arts |publication year=1877 |special status=Endemic |source xml=https://bitbucket.org/aafc-mbb/fna-data-curation/src/2e0870ddd59836b60bcf96646a41e87ea5a5943a/coarse_grained_fna_xml/V19-20-21/V21_1265.xml |tribe=Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae |genus=Brickellia |species=Brickellia greenei }}[[Category:Treatment]][[Category:Brickellia]]

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia hinckleyi |accepted_authority=Standley |publications={{Treatment/Publication |title=Publ. Field Mus. Nat. Hist., Bot. Ser. |place=22: 61. 1940 |year=1940 }} |special_status={{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=E |label=Endemic }}{{Treatment/ID/Special_status |code=C |label=Conservation concern }} |basionyms= |synonyms={{Treatment/ID/Synonym |name=Brickellia brachyphylla var. hinckleyi |authority=(Standley) Flyr |rank=variety }} |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia hinckleyi |hierarchy_nav=
family[[Asteraceae]]
tribe[[Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae]]
genus[[Brickellia]]
species[[Brickellia hinckleyi]]
|volume=Volume 21 |mention_page=page 491 |treatment_page=page 501 }}Perennials, 20–90 cm. Stems branched, coarsely scabrous. Leaves alternate to subopposite; petioles 1–5 mm; blades 3-nerved from bases, lanceolate to lance-ovate, 20–40 × 7–20 mm, bases rounded to broadly cuneate, margins entire or serrate, apices acute to acuminate, faces sparsely pubescent, stipitate-glandular. Heads in open, racemose or paniculiform arrays. Peduncles 5–45 mm, pubescent, stipitate-glandular. Involucres cylindric to campanulate, 7–11 mm. Phyllaries 16–20 in 4–5 series, greenish, often purple-tinged, 4–8-striate, unequal, margins narrowly scarious, often ciliate (apices acute to long-attenuate); outer lance-ovate (pubescent), inner narrowly lanceolate (glabrous). Florets 11–22; corollas pale yellow or cream, 4.7–6 mm. Cypselae 4–5 mm, silvery-setulose. Pappi of 25–34 white, plumose bristles.{{Treatment/Body |distribution=Tex. |discussion=

Varieties 2 (2 in flora).

|tables= |references= }}

{{Treatment/ID |accepted_name=Brickellia hinckleyi var. hinckleyi |accepted_authority= |publications= |basionyms= |synonyms= |hierarchy=Asteraceae;Asteraceae tribe Eupatorieae;Brickellia;Brickellia hinckleyi;Brickellia hinckleyi var. hinckleyi |hierarchy_nav=
